label: Dry Skin
description: Dry skin causes your skin to have a rough texture because it doesn't have enough moisture. Dry skin is very common. The medical term for dry skin is xeroderma.

label: Wrinkle
description: Wrinkles are a natural part of aging. These lines and creases in the skin are most likely to form on skin that's often exposed to the sun, such as the face, neck, hands and forearms.

label: Dark Circles
description: Dark circles are those shadowy areas that appear under your eyes. They can be caused by a variety of factors, including fatigue, allergies, genetics, and sun exposure. While they're usually harmless, some people find them bothersome cosmetically.

label: Oily Skin
description: Oily skin produces excess sebum, an oil made by glands in the skin. This can make the skin appear shiny, especially in the T-zone (forehead, nose, and chin). People with oily skin are more prone to breakouts like pimples and blackheads.

label: Acne
description: Acne is a common skin condition characterized by pimples, blackheads, and cysts. Acne often can be caused by hormonal changes, certain medications, and other factors. While acne is often associated with puberty, it can affect people of all ages.
